Title:
Morphological and molecular Phylogeny of Trentepohliales
(Chlorophyta), from southern China
Keywords:
Cephaleuros, internal system, morphological observation,
paraphyly, Phycopeltis, Printzina, Trentepohlia, zoosporangia
papilla-pore
Abstract:
The Order Trentepohliales contains a complex of five
aerial genera that consist of branched filamentous green algae, in which
polyphyly was found in some genera, including Trentepohlia, Printzina,
and Phycopeltis, and species such as Cephaleuros virescens. In order to
clarify the diversity, distribution and some taxonomic puzzles of
Trentepohliales, we collected specimens from Southern China, and
successfully cultured most of them. We carefully observed the
morphological traits and performed phylogenetic analyses based on new
18S and ITS rDNA sequences obtained during the present study. We
proposed 6 new species in the present study. Our results showed that the
papilla-pore position of the zoosporangia may effectively represent the
two main lineages of Trentepohliales. Both Trentepohlia and Printzina
should be reassessed based on the papilla-pore position of the
zoosporangia. However, we suggest that it is premature to do such
emendation until further molecular investigation, particularly for the
genus Phycopeltis, is performed. In the genus Cephaleuros, we suggest
that the lack of description of its internal system could explain the
specific paraphyly. Further taxonomic studies should focus on emendation
of Cephaleuros and the molecular diversity of Phycopeltis.
